availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh Sobieski Brady (Ohio County, West Virginia, bank cashier)

body.p: Ohio County, West Virginia, bank cashier. Carlisle, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Mary Louise Caldwell Brady. Father of Louisa Brady, Elizabeth C. Brady, Alfred F. Brady, Joanna G. Brady, Charles Neave Brady, Joseph Brady, William Brady, Albert Brady, Fanny Brady, and Jane Brady. Bank cashier in Ohio County, Virginia, in 1850. Cashier of the Merchants and Mechanics Bank in Wheeling, Virginia, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Ohio County, District 44, p. 133B-134A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, West Virginia, Ohio County, Wheeling, Ward 3, p. 200A-200B.
Pennsylvania Death Certificates, 1906-1968, Records of the Pennsylvania Department of Health, Record Group 11, Pennsylvania Historical and Museum Commission in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. Certificate #66148
"Hugh Sobieski Brady (1816-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial #137182178, accessed July 21, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/137182178.
